DOC.HEAD: Pope Expresses `Deep Pain' At Reports of Massacre in Romania
With PM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Pope John Paul II today expressed ``deep pain'' over reports of killings in Romania and said he deplored every act of violence against defenseless citizens. In making his first public statement on the violence in Romania, the pope said he was praying so that fundamental human rights and religious liberty were guaranteed in the country. ``With deep pain we have all heard the news of dead and wounded in some Romanian cities,'' the pope said at the end of his weekly general audience. John Paul said he was praying for the souls of the victims and wanted to express words of comfort ``for the wounded and for all the families that are in anguish because of this tragic event.'' ``God bless Romania,'' the pope said.
